list.title: POPPING THE HOOD: The Grime Behind the Genius
list.description:
Everyone is obsessed with the "shiny red car"—the AI Model. We chase parameters and context windows, fighting to get into the driver's seat. But nobody is asking the most dangerous question: "Is the track safe?" When you put a $15 million machine on a broken track, it doesn’t just stop—it crashes.

AI isn't magic; it's a high-maintenance machine. In this session, we pop the hood to reveal the grime behind the genius. We will leave the "driver obsession" behind and look at the infrastructure required to actually finish the race.

Key Takeaways:

- **The Infrastructure Gap:** Why building 2025 AI on 2015 infrastructure is a guaranteed failure.
- **The Need for Speed:** Why CPUs are just "city streets," GPUs are "highways," and why we need the frictionless "hyperloop" of TPUs to handle modern complexity.
- **The New Threat Vector:** How attacks have shifted from data theft to prompt injection, and why you need "Model Armor" to protect the reasoning mind of your AI.

Stop just driving. Come learn how to build the track.

list.title: Build Your First AI Agent with Google ADK
list.description: Learn to build intelligent AI agents using Google's Agent Development Kit (ADK). In this hands-on workshop, you'll create a custom agent using free-tier resources. We'll walk through crafting agent instructions, understanding function-calling capabilities, testing locally with the playground, and exploring how agents reason and make decisions. You'll work with a starter repository that you can fork and customize for your own projects. Bring your laptop with Python installed and be ready to experiment!

list.title: An incursion into the intriguing world of AI infrastructure
list.description: Environmental and social aspects of AI infrastructure. Exploring the often-overlooked impacts of the physical systems that power modern intelligence.

list.title: How to start building a game and overcome daily challenges
list.description: Curious about making your first game? This session walks you through getting started with a game engine, learning through tutorials and game jams, and using AI to speed up your workflow. Discover how to shape your game loop, design for your audience, and fill your world with assets - whether self-made, sourced, or AI-assisted. Finally, learn how to build your visibility through social media, influencers, and the right release platforms to bring your creation to life.

list.title: The Human Edge: Soft Skills in the Age of AI
list.description: Why Soft Skills Will Define the Future of Work in the Age of AI. While AI excels at data processing, it cannot replicate uniquely human abilities like nuanced judgment, empathy, and ethical decision-making. Learn how to cultivate the capabilities machines can't replace.

list.title: What Models Can See: Inside Modern Computer Vision
list.description: Discover how modern vision models can detect objects without ever being trained on them. Explore the evolution from traditional object detection to zero-shot models like Grounding DINO. Hands-on exploration of text-to-object identification.

list.title: The Tech Talent Barrier Lab
list.description: An interactive data-driven session sharing documented barriers to tech employment. Industry leaders respond with concrete actionable solutions. A collaborative experiment in making hiring systems accountable.

list.title: Punk strategies to find your voice!
list.description: Punk culture, in its political function, stands against the fundamentals of capitalism: anti-consumerism, nonconformity, anti-racism, anti-sexism, and anti-discrimination of all kinds. Appropriation, hacktivism, and culture jamming are among the consistently effective strategies associated with subcultures. We will explore, through examples and case studies, how to remain passionate and relevant by using punk tactics to develop one's voice and maintain a critical perspective.

list.title: Project Management Tools
list.description: Defining requirements goes beyond SMART goals. This talk demonstrates simple tools to define, organize, and prioritize requirements effectively (Eisenhower matrix, SWOT, MoSCoW, INVEST/AQUSA).

list.title: Beyond the Pixel
list.description: Let's create a dialogue between digital and physical communication media. Group exploration of imaginary digital tool designs meeting social needs. Brainstorming, interface design, interaction principles.

list.title: Gamification in the service of science
list.description: Gamification and serious games are powerful levers to make science more accessible. This talk offers a critical perspective on gamification in scientific and educational contexts, discussing success conditions and ethical issues.

list.title: From Theory to Practice: Reinforcement Learning in Video Games
list.description: A pragmatic, production-oriented approach to applying reinforcement learning (RL) to video games. Covers RL principles, integration into Unreal Engine, and automated testing.

list.title: Break It Before They Do - Threat Modeling at Startup Speed
list.description: The internet is adversarial. This talk presents security trends and real-world breaches, followed by a live threat modeling exercise to turn threats into concrete controls.
